modules.description: Translates documentation strings from cmdlang parameter AST nodes into formatted strings for cmdliner. Works directly with `Cmdlang_ast.Ast.Param.t` values and string documents. Useful for generating command-line interface help text from parsed parameter definitions.

Translates cmdlang parser definitions into equivalent Cmdliner command specifications, handling argument parsing and command structure conversion. Works directly with cmdlang's parser AST and generates Cmdliner's term and command values. Used internally to generate command-line interfaces from declarative parser descriptions.

This module translates cmdlang parameter definitions into command-line interfaces using Cmdliner. It processes `Cmdlang_ast.Ast.Param.t` values and parser ASTs to generate formatted help text and command specifications. Key operations include converting parameter nodes into string documents and turning parser definitions into executable Cmdliner commands. For example, it can generate help output from a parameter AST or build a command-line interface from a declarative parser description.

This module translates command definitions from cmdlang into cmdliner-compatible structures, enabling the parsing of command-line arguments and execution of typed interfaces. It processes parameters, arguments, and full commands, converting them into Cmdliner terms with support for validation and help generation. The child module specializes in translating parameter definitions into Cmdliner interfaces, transforming `Cmdlang_ast.Ast.Param.t` values into command-line specifications and generating help text from parser ASTs. Together, they allow building structured CLIs from declarative descriptions, such as generating executable commands or formatted help output from a parser definition.

This module translates command definitions from `cmdlang` into `cmdliner` structures, enabling typed command-line parsing and execution. It converts `Cmdlang_ast.Ast.Param.t` values into `cmdliner` terms, supporting argument validation, help generation, and structured CLI construction. You can generate executable commands or formatted help output from declarative parser definitions. For example, a command with validated integer arguments and custom help text can be built directly from an AST representation.
